title: What is the difference between magic and using natural determinisms for personal goals?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author discussed the difference between magic and science in relation to natural determinism. In the last 200 tokens, the author introduces the concept of unconditional realizations of magic and how it opposes practical applications of science. The author suggests that a world of absolute magic cannot allow the existence of natural determinism as every law and cause-effect relationship would be contingent. The text cites the works of "Vai" and "Iagla" and mentions Milarepa's biography as an example of invisible magical actions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the concept of a magical world in an absolute sense raises the antinomy of determining the external mode of things and the thread of natural determinism. However, some have recognized that magic must logically postulate an unconditional realization, while others maintain that magic is hidden because it can be explained by natural causes but still believe in its power. Ultimately, the inexplicable events attributed to magic may have logical explanations that science has yet to discover.
